title: Simple Italian Fish & Vegetables
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Simple Italian Fish & Vegetables a try. This gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and whole 30 recipe serves 4 and costs $3.37 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 26g of protein, 23g of fat, and a total of 411 calories. Only a few people really liked this Mediterranean dish. This recipe from Kraft Recipes has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 1 hour and 20 minutes. Head to the store and pick up vegetables, viva dressing, whitefish fillets, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the mixed vegetables you could follow this main course with the Pumpkin Pie Dessert as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 75%, this dish is pretty good. Try Simple Grilled Vegetables, Simple Marinated Vegetables, and For My Kids {Simple Roasted Vegetables ) for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 99 dollars.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Pour 3/4 cup of the dressing over fish and vegetables in shallow glass or plastic dish; cover.                                            Refrigerate 30 minutes to 1 hour to marinate.  Drain; discard marinade.                                            Preheat greased grill to medium heat.  Grill fish and vegetables 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork and vegetables are crisp-tender, turning and brushing occasionally with the remaining 1/4 cup dressing.

steps.step: Pour 3/4 cup of the dressing over fish and vegetables in shallow glass or plastic dish; cover.
Refrigerate 30 minutes to 1 hour to marinate.

Preheat greased grill to medium heat.  Grill fish and vegetables 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork and vegetables are crisp-tender, turning and brushing occasionally with the remaining 1/4 cup dressing.
